transcript.title: DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT
transcript.content:
PRESS STATEMENT 499
21 April, 1975
DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENT
The Prime Minister has announced that the Governor-General
today approved the change of the name of the Department of the
Environment and Conservation to the Department of Environment.
The Governor-General subsequently swore the Honourable Moss Cass,
M. P. as Minister of State for Environment.
Thie Prime Minister said that the former name suggested
that conservation was a separate matter from the environment
whereas it was in fact a major component of the Government's
total environmental program. To refer to it as a separate area
of concern was misleading.
The Prime Minister noted also that " evrnet is
the term used by all relevant United Nations agencies and the
O. E. C. D. and includes all conservation programs of those bodies.
CANBERRA, A. C. T.
